info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 14 at 8:54AM MDT until October 14 at 11:30AM MDT by NWS Pueblo CO
info.description:
* WHAT...The Colorado State Patrol and CDOT have reported large amounts of water flowing over highway 160 between mile markers 157 through 185. Highway 160 between Pagosa Springs and South Fork has been closed. In addition, the Rio Grande river in South Fork is above flood stage. Several homes in South Fork have been flooded.
* WHERE...A portion of south central Colorado, including the following counties, Mineral and Rio Grande.
* WHEN...Until 1130 AM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 848 AM MDT, Flood reports were from fire department officials in South Fork along with CDOT and Colorado State Patrol personnel - This includes the following streams and drainages... Hope Creek, Pass Creek, South Fork Rio Grande, Park Creek, West Fork Park Creek, Grande, Rio, Trout Creek, Burro Creek, Treasure Creek, Quartz Creek, Lane Creek, Lake Creek, Kitty Creek, Bear Creek, Fall Creek, Crater Creek, Decker Creek, Sierra Creek, Beaver Creek, Wolf Creek, Alder Creek, Kelly Creek, Archuleta Creek, San Juan River, West Fork San Juan River and Cross Creek. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... South Fork and Wolf Creek Pass. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 AM MDT THIS MORNING
